alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 7:13PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north Lake and north Volusia Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 711 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Juniper Springs, moving northeast at 20 mph. Additional numerous, strong, storms will affect portions of north Volusia and north Lake counties this evening with heavy rainfall. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Daytona Beach, Ormond Beach, DeLand, Holly Hill and Pierson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
